title: I_Anime
author: I_Anime
content: I posted something today but it was deleted and I just don't know what I did wrong. Please can someone help me with the reason for this and also the rules and regulations of this forum  I just want to avoid any complications next time am starting a topic

comments.author: Queentoshi
comments.body: I understand how you must have felt after your post was deleted, do not take it too seriously, most forum users have had their post deleted at one time in their forum history, you are not the first. Your post was deleted because it most likely did not fit into any board for discussions, and it did not also make sense enough to be sent to the off-topic side of forum. Do not be discouraged please OP, you are not targeted, and nobody hates you.

comments.author: examplens
comments.body: Quote from: I_Anime on December 26, 2022, 05:50:45 PMI posted something today but it was deleted and I just don't know what I did wrong. Please can someone help me with the reason for this and also the rules and regulations of this forum  I just want to avoid any complications next time am starting a topic I assume you mean the deleted topic you started https://ninjastic.space/topic/5431651I guess that the reason for the deletion is that the post was characterized as useless spam, which it actually is. the basis of your topic is actually linked to other articles, without establishing a useful discussion. it seems that you mixed up some things, this is not Facebook where cluttering up with unnecessary things is a normal phenomenon.to all that, another user gave a reply, also sharing a link to the third article. don't turn this forum into a backlink collector, and simply sharing other articles will not make your posts more qualitative or constructive.

comments.author: Dunamisx
comments.body: have you taken your time to read about the forum rules and regulations? have you even take to notice the pinned threads on each boards, not until you discover the reasons why you're having such experience you will continue to see more coming, i will drop you two links to read on.Newbies read before postinghttps://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=1689727.0Low quality topics do not belong herehttps://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=1649348.0after going through these thread i think you should be able to discover why post got deleted by the moderator which is unquestionable, i will advise you also learn to increase your post quality and and always be on point whenever you're discussion a topic or creating one.

comments.author: Renampun
comments.body: Quote from: I_Anime on December 26, 2022, 05:50:45 PMI posted something today but it was deleted and I just don't know what I did wrong. usually, someone's post gets deleted because it was reported by a member in this forum to the moderator for various reasons (some reported it was spam - off topic - scam or plagiarism), in between all this, you have to think for yourself what you did wrong.Quote from: I_Anime on December 26, 2022, 05:50:45 PMPlease can someone help me with the reason for this and also the rules and regulations of this forum  I just want to avoid any complications next time am starting a topic I think you should read @examplens post, he has explained your mistake and I completely agree with what he said. in the future you have to improve your post, don't copy everything in the article but write down the conclusions you get in your own language and writing style.

comments.author: Anguwa
comments.body: Quote from: I_Anime on December 26, 2022, 05:50:45 PMI posted something today but it was deleted and I just don't know what I did wrong. Please can someone help me with the reason for this and also the rules and regulations of this forum  I just want to avoid any complications next time am starting a topic The job of the forum moderators is to keep an eye on the posts' quality in order to prevent an excessive amount of spam. Occasionally, if a thread is meaningless, the entire thing will be deleted, including all comments. To prevent this from happening again, it is important to continue posting high-quality content and to comment frequently on other high-quality posts.

comments.author: _act_
comments.body: Let me give you an additional advice. If a post is a spam, it will be deleted, your post was deleted because it is not of good quality. I will advice you to just be patient, learn about this forum, about how good posters are posting, you will later understand why your post was deleted after you are posting better and increasing your posts quality.

comments.author: hopenotlate
comments.body: Do not take it personal and pay too much importance if your post has bene delete, besides the other threads alreday suggested by other users you might also want ti read this one : https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=703657.0We were all newbies once.

comments.author: The Cryptovator
comments.body: For newbies, not focusing on creating new posts is preferable. It's because you need to first learn about the forum culture. Mods will not notify you as to why your post was deleted. Someone most likely reported it to prevent spam. So avoid spamming the forum and keep it clean. Mods definitely did the right thing, so act accordingly. You must be an good contributor in the forum. As a result, your posts will not be deleted. But don't take it seriously; occasionally, though somewhat infrequently, our posts are deleted. But this is normal; when mods deem a post unnecessary, it is deleted. Rather, concentrate on improving your posting quality.

comments.author: kamvreto
comments.body: As stated by @examplens, the OP only made a copy of the text from the website and only gave a little description, even though the Op could explain in detail what the meaning of some of the critical points to be discussed was. Just making copies and providing article links will only end up like spam without having a quality post and a clear purpose.Quote from: examplens on December 26, 2022, 06:08:11 PM~snip~to all that, another user replied, also sharing a link to the third article. don't turn this forum into a backlink collector, and simply sharing other articles will not make your posts more qualitative or constructive.Many beginners and even some old members provide copy-paste replies accompanied by an article link and only seem to stick together without giving their opinion, so that a qualitative and constructive post will not be created, and no more effort to think about what will be described.

comments.author: KingsDen
comments.body: Quote from: I_Anime on December 26, 2022, 05:50:45 PMI posted something today but it was deleted and I just don't know what I did wrong. Please can someone help me with the reason for this and also the rules and regulations of this forum  I just want to avoid any complications next time am starting a topic Your posts are deleted when you spam, when you make off topic contributions. It could be that you contributed to an off topic discussion and the whole discussion is deleted. comments.author: Gozie51
comments.body: Generally if you post is not adding value to the topic value to the forum it can be deleted. You have to understand that people can report your post to moderator and it will be looked at for action to be taken to delete it or not. Not only topic that can be deleted but replies if they are not making any contribution. Like someone said, you have to add more value to what you post.

comments.author: GxSTxV
comments.body: Quote from: I_Anime on December 26, 2022, 05:50:45 PM  I just want to avoid any complications next time am starting a topic Well these are the things and type of posts you should avoid posting and these kind of posts are deleted by moderatorsSpam posts that are purely promotional in nature and do not contribute to the discussion are considered spam.Off-topic posts that are not relevant to the discussion or forum section in which they are postedIllegal content posts that contain illegal or inappropriate content, such as child pornography or illegal activitiesCopyright violations posts that contain copyrighted material or that infringe on the intellectual property rights of others are not allowedWhile the rest of posts such as fraudulent posts you most likely to get a red trust in your profile

comments.author: MarjorieZimmermanGinger
comments.body: Quote from: I_Anime on December 26, 2022, 05:50:45 PMI posted something today but it was deleted and I just don't know what I did wrong. Please can someone help me with the reason for this and also the rules and regulations of this forum  I just want to avoid any complications next time am starting a topic I found many cases regarding the deletion of posts, to be honest there are many reasons why many posts were deleted and I think these reasons have been explained by many other users. If I may say try to avoid writing that is not clear, plagiarism and practical politics, even if you attach a lot of sources, because this forum was not designed for that, there are many rules that you must learn so that in the future no more posts will be deleted.Don't worry, most people have experienced this in the past including myself, continue to learn to improve the quality of posts, for something that is useful that is easily understood by many people and more make constructive posts. Master what you want to write, but don't force what you don't understand.

I would advice you to keep learning because having your post deleted in the forum is just part of the learning process, take it as a positive energy and make more research on the thread and forum before posting next time.As you have already been given a guideline on links you are to read and improve yourself by other members, I would just advice you to go and read more before you post next time.Never stop learning thats the whole concept of the forum.

comments.author: Obari
comments.body: Most times, one of the major reason why a post might be deleted is if the entire thread gets deleted.There are whole lot of threads created especially by newbies just for the sake of getting noticed on here and a basically don't blame them because I've come to understand that learning never ends which is very evident here in the forum.There are just few things to follow up with on the forum and plagiarism is one so in all you do, don't plagiarize and always reference whatever writing not done by you.
